Album Info wrote:
Good Times, Bad Times... Ten Years of Godsmack is a greatest hits collection by heavy metal band Godsmack. The collection includes all of Godsmack's singles, with the exception of "Bad Magick" and "Bring It On" , and a DVD of the band's acoustic performance in Las Vegas, Nevada at the The House of Blues.

image
Biography wrote:
Godsmack is an American heavy metal band from Lawrence, Massachusetts, formed in 1995. The band comprises founder, frontman and songwriter Sully Erna, guitarist Tony Rombola, bassist Robbie Merrill and drummer Shannon Larkin. Since its formation, Godsmack has released four studio albums, one EP, four DVDs, and one greatest hits collection.

The band has sold over 17 million records in the United States according to the RIAA. And nearly 20 million records worldwide, the band has had two consecutive number-one albums (Faceless and IV) on the Billboard 200. They have had seventeen top ten mainstream rock singles, being the only band ever to do so and a debut album that has sold over 5 million copies since its release. Since its inception, Godsmack has toured on Ozzfest on more than one occasion, and have toured with many other large tours and festivals, including supporting its albums with its own arena tours and will be playing in CrÃƒÂ¼e Fest 2.
